intro: Scelochilus pseudochiribogae, commonly known as the Chilean rock cactus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Chile. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its succulent stems and spines. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has adapted to survive in dry, harsh environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, rounded fruits. Scelochilus pseudochiribogae is a rare species, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
